alert.note: Alert for Southern Nassau; Southern Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 6:34AM EDT until September 29 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 1 PM EDT FRIDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM FRIDAY TO 2 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the third Coastal Flood Advisory, up up to 1 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southern Queens and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to midnight EDT tonight. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 AM to 1 PM EDT Friday. For the third Coastal Flood Advisory, from 7 PM Friday to 2 AM EDT Saturday. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread minor coastal flooding, with up to 1 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level, during the times of high tide this evening into Friday evening. This will result in several road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront may become flooded. * BEACH EROSION AND FLOODING IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 4 to 7 ft will cause significant beach erosion and escarpment, with scattered areas of beach flooding and dune erosion during the time of high tide. The potential for localized overwashes is low. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional rounds of minor coastal flooding are likely during the times of high tide this weekend. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
